name: Mikemike Fuqua
text:
You take product working and get product back not working.
This business  beat around the Bush when they done f××k up your product. Then come to found didnt even know what they were working on.  It funny how they  on the road when you want to pick your product after waiting for 4 months on it, but really at the shop the whole time half way putting your product back together .

resp.text: Sorry if your experience didn't meet you expectation.  However, every possible attempt was made to fix your unit.  The problem was related to a part that leaked on the PC board causing corrosion.  A part needed was on backorder from the Manufacture with no ETA.  The unit was reassembled completely before pickup.  Again we are sorry we couldn't work this out in a timely manner.

name: MaryBeth Winter
text: I had horrible luck and dropped my iMac, cracking the screen as I was unpacking from our move. PC Tech Computer Repair was the second place I called after a store in Enterprise, AL told me they were the closest place that repaired Apple Computers. The employees at PC Tech Repair displayed genuine customer service. They were kind, honest, fair, and repaired my computer in a timely manner. The screen they ordered to fix my computer was cracked worse than my original, they promptly called me and communicated that it would take longer to repair because they had to order an additional and have it shipped. I appreciated this communication so much!  Upon pick up, I came in with my 1 year old and the guy even helped to carry my repaired computer to my car! I will be using PC Tech Repair for any of my future tech needs and will definitely be recommending them to friends! Their customer service was phenomenal (which is what truly matters!)

I called Shawn as he proceeded to say that that happens sometimes and his kid must have forgot to put it back in when they were looking for the issue. name: Cindy Wright
text: I took a large screen RCA television in for a repair in late March, early April.  May came and I called to check on the status of the repair.  I was told by Mr.Dean the part had not come in.  I thanked him and continued my wait.  I called regularly after that and got a recording, which, I left numerous messages for him to please call me and let me know what the status of the repair was.  I went by the shop numerous times to find nobody in the office.  Last week I went by again to learn that he had closed up shop and took my television with him.  No warning.  No call.  Nothing.  He has had it for 3 months and I have had no contact with him, except the one call I initiated.  I was told he had a sickness in his family.  I can understand that and have been more than patient in the situation, but to find he closed the shop without reaching out to me is the worse kind of professionalism.  Now when I call the number the phone has been disconnected.  I’m left to consider if I let it go, or file small claims.  I am a very unhappy customer with this business.  I pray for the sick family member, but he handled his business very poorly.

name: Antoinette Dew
text: I have had a 65" LG that had to have new back lights done about a year ago and just took my 55" Vizio in because the lights were loose and every time I turned it on my shows/movies/games looked like there were 15 bright suns.  He is always honest and if there are different options he goes through in detail what can be done and the expected results.  I live almost an hour away now and I would make the drive to bring my TV's to him.  He is the only person I trust and his prices are more than fair!  It's a shame he only fixes TV's because I believe if he made them they would be better quality than these large corporation whose machines produce quantity but not so much quality anymore.  He also fixed my TV's quick!  My 55" was dropped off Saturday, parts ordered Monday ready for pickup on Thursday!  You can go where you want but you will not regret bringing it here.

I dropped my TV off and they were very pleasant and helpful. They told me they'd call me as soon as it was done. After 4 weeks I called them back. This is where it went down hill.

This was a Friday and they said they'd have it done Monday. I called in Tuesday and it wasn't done. Called back Thursday and they said it would be ready the following Monday. Monday comes around and they have an excuse why it isn't ready. The following week comes up and they finally admit that they can't find the part needed to fix it. I went to pick it up the next day and they said the part was located and would be there in 2 days. A week later I called to check on it and was told the only part in the entire U.S. they could find to fix it (the motherboard) didn't work and they couldn't get another one anywhere else to fix it. The reason I know this is because, they have a habit of resting the TVs on the edge on concrete.  (You can see evidence of this by walking in the front door)  Unfortunately, some nicer LCDs have trim edges that are easily broken, scuffed, scratched. NO matter how careful you are if you are setting LCD monitors on concrete you will get damage.  Details like this annoy me. Its sooooo easy to have a strip of carpet that would help protect edges and such.  I also am bummed they dont care enough to do this. text: I own a plumbing company. Very good guys with electronics & only guys I trust to repair our sewer camera equipment. Only reason not 5 stars is due to turn around time being slow due to there demand.

name: Jermaine Fikes
text: The guys what worked there was very knowledgeable and nice

name: Danny Partain
text: I took a KD-4100R that I inherited And it wouldn’t work to these guys years ago. They replaced the head shell, cartridge, stylus, and gave it the TLC it needed. I have been using it without problem since. it’s been at least 10 years.

name: Tim Gillespie
text: a really high dollar place 2 go

name: alvin frazier
text: I have taken several items and was always treated with professionalism.

name: Joseph Lathem
text: I brought in an old power amp from the 90's years ago. Unit was making a noise. These guys called the next day claiming they had been playing it all day and there was no problem. I pick the unit back up and take a bath on my assessment fee (commonly $60 for most repair outlets) because the unit was clearly defective and still making the noise when I plugged it up back home. Took it to another tech service company and they immediately took care of the repair (loose solder joint, resistor issue)...

name: jstudstill
text: The guys were very helpful and explained all options before taking any action. My record player works splendidly now and I feel they were honest with me. I will definitely come back. Thanks!

name: Danae Jones
text: A huge waste of time AND MONEY!!! This man  DOES NOT STAND BY HIS WORK. DOES NOT REFUND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY  WHEN HE DOES NOT REPAIR YOUR  ITEM. YOU WILL  STILL HAVE A BROKEN ITEM AND LOSE MONEY.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! MY opinion  a total SCAM  ARTIST.  TAKES MONEY AND DOESN'T REPAIR  YOUR ITEM!!   How can you  do people like that?? I hope karma  treats you the way you treat your customers. You sir are what is wrong with this world, people trust you to do  the job you are paid to do, fix their items. Instead you don't fix their item and keep their money. In my opinion  that is stealing, you didn't earn the money!!!!

name: Ben Martin
text: Great job on my amp repair.  I think it works better than when new.  Very professional  and prompt service.  I highly recommend Frankie for complex repairs.

name: Dori Long
text: My husband paid this man to fix his welder circuit board. He DID NOT  fix the circuit board AND  kept our money. Didn't stand behind his work or his word. Will be reported to the better business bureau !!

name: Aaron Smith
text: Very friendly and experienced! I would recommend franky to anyone that needs repair done. Great job Thank You very much.

name: tim long
text: Do not bring anything to Frankie for repair. I hired him to repair the circuit board in my welder. Paid him for the job, which only half of it was done. Asked him to replace all of the capacitors on the board. He did not. He left a diode that he had cut loose. The soldering was the worst looking hack jobs I have ever seen. He picked up the board and was paid $90 initially to check it on the machine. I had to drive to Dothan to retrieve it from him and paid the balance of $145. Installed the board and the welder has no output at all now. Originally agreed upon price was $220. When I got the board back the diode was never reconnected, the solder joints were ridiculously poor. And the welder still does not work. He came out and wanted another $25 to “check” the board again. He came and “checked” the board again. He said there is another bad part on the board. How could there be another bad part if he checked the whole board. So after seeing the poor workmanship displayed. I asked for a partial refund. He said no. So now I am out $235 and my welder still doesn’t work. If I had only known that he couldn’t do the job to start with, I would never have hired him to do it. This guy does not know what he is doing! Please save your hard earned money. Seek out a professional. Don’t get screwed like I did!

name: rob merritt
text: Frankie is a hack and a tool at best. He is not a man of his word. He thrives on only doing part of the job, so that you call him for extra costly service calls. Also not impressed with his Harbor Freight soldering gun (which he isn't very proficient with) . His guarantees are worthless. POS

name: stephanie phillips
text: Did a great job on the repair you did on our juke box.. thanks again

name: Cynondria
text:
He never showed up. I called Frankie at 10 am to get my tv fixed. We set up an appointment at 4 the same day. I drove from Daleville with a 60 inch tv (very heavy to lug down a flight of stairs during a storm) to get it fixed. When we got there it was a little past 4 so I called him on his phone. He said he was on a service call and to wait for him til 5. Okay sure. So we drove around for a bit before coming back at 5. We tried calling but he wouldn’t answer pick up.we waited out there til 6:25 and tried calling a few more times before giving up. If you run a Business and set up an appointment please be professional about it. Because not only did you waste my time but you wasted my gas and that’s money. :/ the least that could have been done was to set up an appointment for another day or at least tell us you were too busy or something. Ignoring customers is not the answer.

Edit 1/3: he messaged us to repair our tv a few days after the above incident. We let him take it. He stole our tv and closed his business. What a scam. I will be coming over to the business to claim the television set we left there

name: Willie Thornton
text: He's a good guy when it comes to help on ur electronic

name: Keith Hudson
text: Great repair work on a 25 year old Only FM receiver. Thanks!

name: Mark Given
text: Frankie repaired my old 70’s Marantz receiver back to new. Great work, quick turnaround and all at a fair price.

name: Layna Cook
text: Awesome service . fast and friendly!! Highly recommend!!!

name: Bryan Dawkins
text: Fast friendly service, with quality work!!!!
